title: Alarm clock not working if device switched off

thread.text:
Before XA1 - actually a 3 days ago - I had my previous smartphone called Alcatel One Touch Pop C7 7041D. When I set my morning alarm and switched off the smartphone (and I really mean switched off not going into sleep mode: holding on/off button -> select 'switch off the device') it would automatically wake up at the specific time ringing the alarm for me (and it was its default stock clock/alarm).
With SONY XA1 I am unable to achieve this, the stock alarm does not wake up (= switching on) the device when I switched my SONY off.
Why is this happening? Like this feature was on all my latest phones prior to XA1 (like even 4 years ago or so) but not with the actual newest Android 7?!
Huh. I've never heard of that one! Usually off means off in any phone I've owned!
Some phones have the option in the clock app settings for the alarm to work even if you power off the phone.

You need to have your phone on in order for the alarm to work. It's a cumbersome issue but a small issue that can be resolved by just going into do not disturb mode and allow alarms only.
Hope your enjoying the Xperia XA1 other then that.
Éire
My BlackBerry devices (and now my Honor 8) will turn on for the alarm to go off at my specified time; but many phones do not have this option.

title: Phone Screen Flashing when USB car charging?

thread.text: I just purchased the XA1 Ultra and only when I attempt to charge the phone turned off and plugged into the cars usb port the whole display turns on and off (flashing) to a white screen and never stops doing this. If I charge with the phone turned on its fine. If I use the wall charger its fine also. Any idea's?

replies.text:
The voltage of the USB port may differ from that of the AC Charger. You may do a soft reset on your phone (holding power and restart device).
The other piece of advise would be try and use the same car charger that matches your phone not all car chargers give the same voltage out or some chargers may not work as efficiently.
Try and charge your phone before it drops below 10% just for safety when driving at night and during the day do the same.
Normally I'd let my battery die then charge to preserve battery life but in your case for safety when battery drops to 10% then charge it.
Hope this helps.
Éire

title: Sony Xperia XA1 not quick charging

thread.text:
My new Xperia XA1 is not quick charging using the original UCH12. I installed the ampere app to check. And the UCH12 doesn't charge any faster over the stock charger.
What's even stranger, is that I already had this UCH12 with my previous phone, the Xperia Z5C, and it did use the quickcharge capabilities. 
I took it back out of storage and tested both devices with the ampere app. The Z5C was allowing a whopping 2550 amp! Whilst the XA doesn't come any further then just under 1000 amps.
Is there some kind of hidden setting that I need to toggle??

mAmps, not Amps, but no, there's no setting. From 0% (which you should never let the battery drop to) to 50%, the charge will be higher. Above 50% (70% in some phones), it goes down to normal charge. (And since you should never allow a lithium battery to drop below 40%, it's more a gimmick than anything else, it won't go from 40% to 100% much faster.)

I have an Xperia XA1 and mine quick charges from 0% I always let my battery run out as this preserves the life cycle of the battery also quick charge batteries have a chip in them that when they charge from empty they get stronger and hold their charge longer. The battery instinctively knows the user and gets to know the users usage. These batteries are smart batteries now what I would suggest to you is back up your phone and then factory reset or hard reset the phone. Your better off not using third party apps to judge the health of your battery as the app may not be working with the latest info on your phone. The forum was only created for this phone only recently so it's not a stretch to think third party apps wouldn't have the schematics of our battery system. Factory reset it and then check to see if it works I if not and the phone still in warranty you could get a Sony center rep to fix or repair the battery.

If you have any queries regarding your device please feel free to post here and please keep comments friendly.
Éire Sony Xperia XA1
